alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 8:34PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Norfolk, City of Portsmouth and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 PM EST, the public reported ponding of water on roadways in Virginia Beach. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen this afternoon and evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Regent University, Kempsville, Great Bridge, Virginia Wesleyan University, Norfolk State University, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Deep Creek, Old Dominion University, Ocean View, Churchland, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Fentress, Princess Anne, Back Bay and Norfolk International. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach
